Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ricaecilin (RC, UCSS1a; 2S=S, natural AMPs, caecilians, limbless amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: homologous search of the BRICHOS domain, cleavage site RR, followed by mature AMP.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (61.9%) toMicaecilinF=C: 20%; R: 15%; V=Y: 10%. GRAVY: 0.845; mol wt: 2561.129; mol formula: C119H171N31O24S4; mol ex coeff: 3230.Activity: active against E. coli ML-35p or ESBL 521/17  (MIC 2-4 uM), A. baumannii 16.63 or 7226/16 (MIC 2-4 uM), P. aeruginosa MDR 522/17 (MIC 2 uM), K. pneumoniae ESBL 344/17  (MIC 2 uM), and S. aureus 1399/17 (MIC 2 uM).Toxicity: human RBC; HC30 >100 uM (less than 20% hemolysis at 100 uM, less hemo.lytic); PBMC (IC50 41.4 uM); A549/K562/NHDF cells (IC50 >100 uM), EA. hy926 (IC50 23.6 uM).MOA:bacteria:E. coli: membrane permeabilization.Structure: became a beta-sheet in micelles esp. SDS (CD 215 nm band), consistent with alpha-fold predicted beta-sheet structure stabilized by two disulfide bonds.
Literature Information.Author: Smetanin RV, Sukhareva MS, Vladimirova EV, Zharkova MS, Mikushina AD, Komlev AS, Khaydukova MM, Filatenkova TA, Kalganova AI, Pipiya SO, Terekhov SS, Orlov DS, Shamova OV, Eliseev IE. 2024
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2024 Apr 10;712-713:149913. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2024.149913.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: First vertebrate BRICHOS antimicrobial peptides: beta-hairpin host defense peptides in limbless amphibia lung resemble those of marine worms.
